item.title: Getting started with homebrew
item.description: Installation # Homebrew can be installed using the following command in the terminal: /usr/bin/ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)" It runs as the current user; you don’t need to use sudo. The script can be viewed online and will print a summary of what it’ll do before actually doing it. You then have to add /usr/local/bin to your PATH if it’s not already there. Run the following command to check: echo $PATH If you don’t see /usr/local/bin in the output you’ll have to add it.
